decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantages through card selection and efficient threats. By utilizing a diverse mana base and a mix of powerful spells, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in the long game. With a variety of disruptive elements and powerful finishers, the deck looks to maintain control of the game and eventually close it out with overwhelming threats.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and selection, while cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower help to protect the combo. The deck aims to cheat big threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty into play early, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to recover.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and blue cards to quickly disrupt the opponent and generate card advantage. By combining powerful artifact mana acceleration like Grim Monolith and Mox Opal with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Stock Up, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with threats like Kozilek's Command and Glaring Fleshraker. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Sink into Stupor further solidify the deck's ability to control the game and push for a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. It aims to bring out game-changing creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the board. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures, reanimation spells, and control elements to create a strong synergy and win the game through a fast and explosive strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and overwhelm opponents quickly. By playing efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Gaddock Teeg, this deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain pressure throughout the game. The use of Green Sun's Zenith allows for flexibility in finding key creatures, while cards like Endurance provide graveyard hate and additional disruption against certain strategies. The land base is specifically tailored to enable the deck's strategy and provide consistency in mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to cheat the powerful Eldrazi creature into play for a game-winning surprise attack. The deck includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and tutoring to help find and protect the combo pieces, with Cunning Wish providing additional flexibility and options. The inclusion of Veil of Summer offers protection against disruptive spells, while Stock Up allows for card advantage and filtering. The deck aims to efficiently execute its combo and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with key combo pieces and then use spells like Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck utilizes a mix of fast mana in Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, along with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The combo relies on a delicate balance of self-mill and reanimation spells to assemble the necessary pieces to execute the win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to filter through the deck and find key cards, while also including land disruption elements like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on aggressive early game plays, utilizing fast mana sources like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Chrome Mox to quickly establish a board presence. The creatures in the deck are designed to disrupt the opponent's plans, with cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Magus of the Moon creating roadblocks for their strategies. Chalice of the Void acts as a lockdown against opposing spells, while Broadside Bombardiers offer additional aggression. The mana base is streamlined to support these plays, with cards like City of Traitors and Cavern of Souls providing additional utility.

This deck aims to win the game quickly by using a combination of cards that allow for a fast and consistent combo. It focuses on playing spells that can quickly mill through the library and win the game by revealing Thassa's Oracle. The deck is designed to be able to play a large number of spells in a short amount of time, with cards like Simian Spirit Guide, Lotus Petal, and Dark Ritual helping to accelerate the combo. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Duress help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb, and then lock down the opponent's options with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon. The deck also aims to aggressively attack the opponent with powerful creatures like Pyrogoyf and Magus of the Moon, while using cards like Sundering Eruption and Fury to control the board. Overall, the deck focuses on fast mana acceleration and disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back to the battlefield for a strong tempo advantage. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate high-impact creatures like Murktide Regent, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Archon of Cruelty to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional card advantage and control options.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also ramping up quickly with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays using dragons and other powerful creatures like Pyrogoyf and Fury. The goal is to have a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Legacy UR Aggro deck is to establish early board presence and tempo advantage by deploying efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck focuses on applying pressure through aggressive creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, while also creating card advantage and filtering through the deck with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. Additionally, the deck utilizes land disruption with Wasteland to keep the opponent off balance and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful, expensive creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Reanimate, Entomb, and Animate Dead. It also includes control elements like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Daze to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces as quickly as possible while maintaining card advantage and control over the game. The key strategy is to reanimate high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck revolves around quickly assembling the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill your entire library, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for an instant win. The deck includes protection with Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card draw and filtering with Brainstorm and Ponder. Urza's Saga helps tutor for key combo pieces, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom provide additional card advantage. The deck aims to win by quickly and efficiently executing its combo, while disrupting opponents with countermagic and removal spells.
